entry.content:

entry.title: Episodic and associative memory from spatial scaffolds in the hippocampus
entry.content:
Episodic and associative memory from spatial scaffolds in the hippocampus

A neocortical–entorhinal–hippocampal network model based on grid cell states recapitulates experimental results and reconciles the spatial, associative and episodic memory roles of the hippocampus.

  • Sarthak Chandra
  • Sugandha Sharma
  • Ila Fiete
Article15 Jan 2025

entry.title: All-solid-state Li–S batteries with fast solid–solid sulfur reaction
entry.content:
All-solid-state Li–S batteries with fast solid–solid sulfur reaction

By using lithium thioborophosphate iodide glass-phase solid electrolytes in all-solid-state lithium–sulfur batteries, fast solid–solid sulfur redox reaction is demonstrated, leading to cells with ultrafast charging capability, superior cycling stability and high capacity.

  • Huimin Song
  • Konrad Münch
  • Quanquan Pang
Article15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Continental influx and pervasive matrilocality in Iron Age Britain
entry.content:
Continental influx and pervasive matrilocality in Iron Age Britain

An analysis of ancient mitochondrial and nuclear DNA shows evidence of matrilocal communities in Iron Age Britain.

  • Lara M. Cassidy
  • Miles Russell
  • Daniel G. Bradley
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Targeting protein–ligand neosurfaces with a generalizable deep learning tool
entry.content:
Targeting protein–ligand neosurfaces with a generalizable deep learning tool

A computational deep learning approach is used to design synthetic proteins that target the neosurfaces formed by protein–ligand interactions, with applications in the development of new therapeutic modalities such as molecular glues or cell-based therapies.

  • Anthony Marchand
  • Stephen Buckley
  • Bruno E. Correia
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Prolonged persistence of mutagenic DNA lesions in somatic cells
entry.content:
Prolonged persistence of mutagenic DNA lesions in somatic cells

Persistent DNA lesions can occur throughout the human lifespan and can remain in the genome of affected cells for several years and generate a substantial proportion of the mutational burden.

  • Michael Spencer Chapman
  • Emily Mitchell
  • Peter J. Campbell
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025

entry.title: GZMK-expressing CD8+ T cells promote recurrent airway inflammatory diseases
entry.content:
GZMK-expressing CD8+ T cells promote recurrent airway inflammatory diseases

Comparing T cells in nasal polyps from repeated surgeries shows that effector memory-like persistent clones colonize the mucosal tissue during disease recurrence and promote inflammation by producing Granzyme K, a complement-activating tryptase, which is a potential therapeutic target.

  • Feng Lan
  • Jizhou Li
  • Hai Qi
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Massively parallel characterization of transcriptional regulatory elements
entry.content:
Massively parallel characterization of transcriptional regulatory elements

Lentivirus-based reporter assays for 680,000 regulatory sequences from three cell lines coupled to machine-learning models lead to insights into the grammar of cis-regulatory elements.

  • Vikram Agarwal
  • Fumitaka Inoue
  • Nadav Ahituv
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Structural insights into RNA cleavage by PIWI Argonaute
entry.content:
Structural insights into RNA cleavage by PIWI Argonaute

After target binding, PIWI proteins undergo a conformational change from ‘open’ to ‘locked’, facilitating base pairing and enhancing target cleavage efficiency, providing insights into how dynamic conformational changes from PIWI coordinate cofactors to safeguard gametogenesis.

  • Zhiqing Li
  • Qikui Xu
  • En-Zhi Shen
Article15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Targeting FOXM1 condensates reduces breast tumour growth and metastasis
entry.content:
Targeting FOXM1 condensates reduces breast tumour growth and metastasis

The transcription factor FOXM1 forms functional condensates, the formation of which can be targeted with a specific peptide to suppress breast cancer growth and metastasis.

  • Feng Xie
  • Xiaoxue Zhou
  • Long Zhang
Article15 Jan 2025

entry.title: IL-33-activated ILC2s induce tertiary lymphoid structures in pancreatic cancer
entry.content:
IL-33-activated ILC2s induce tertiary lymphoid structures in pancreatic cancer

IL-33 induces tertiary lymphoid structures.

  • Masataka Amisaki
  • Abderezak Zebboudj
  • Vinod P. Balachandran
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Long-lived entanglement of molecules in magic-wavelength optical tweezers
entry.content:
Long-lived entanglement of molecules in magic-wavelength optical tweezers

By engineering an exceptionally controlled environment using rotationally magic optical tweezers, long-lived entanglement between pairs of molecules using detectable hertz-scale interactions can be achieved.

  • Daniel K. Ruttley
  • Tom R. Hepworth
  • Simon L. Cornish
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025

entry.title: De novo designed proteins neutralize lethal snake venom toxins
entry.content:
De novo designed proteins neutralize lethal snake venom toxins

Deep learning methods have been used to design proteins that can neutralize the effects of three-finger toxins found in snake venom, which could lead to the development of safer and more accessible antivenom treatments.

  • Susana Vázquez Torres
  • Melisa Benard Valle
  • David Baker
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Ensemble reactivations during brief rest drive fast learning of sequences
entry.content:
Ensemble reactivations during brief rest drive fast learning of sequences

In macaques, motor cortex activity associated with motor learning tasks is reactivated during brief breaks between learning blocks and predicts subsequent performance gains.

  • Sandon Griffin
  • Preeya Khanna
  • Karunesh Ganguly
Article15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Bilayer nanographene reveals halide permeation through a benzene hole
entry.content:
Bilayer nanographene reveals halide permeation through a benzene hole

Halide permeation through a single benzene-sized defect in a molecular nanographene shows the permeability of fluoride, chloride and bromide, whereas iodide is impermeable.

  • M. A. Niyas
  • Kazutaka Shoyama
  • Frank Würthner
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025

entry.title: Autoactive CNGC15 enhances root endosymbiosis in legume and wheat
entry.content:
Autoactive CNGC15 enhances root endosymbiosis in legume and wheat

Nuclear calcium oscillations initiate plant–arbuscular mycorrhiza and nitrogen-fixing bacteria symbioses for nutrient acquisition, with a newly discovered autoactive CNGC15 mutant enhancing these partnerships, potentially improving crop nutrition and reducing inorganic fertilizer dependence.

  • Nicola M. Cook
  • Giulia Gobbato
  • Myriam Charpentier
ArticleOpen Access15 Jan 2025
